citation.article-title: Citreicella aestuarii sp. nov., isolated from a tidal flat
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Citreicella aestuarii sp. nov.
Citreicella aestuarii (a.es.tu.a′ri.i. L. gen. n. aestuarii of a tidal flat, from where the organism was isolated).
Colonies on MA are pale beige, convex, round and non-pigmented with entire margins.
Cells are Gram-stain-negative, strictly aerobic rods or ovoid rods (1.0–1.4 µm wide and 1.6–2.2 µm long).
Motile by means of two lateral flagella on one side of a cell.
Growth occurs at 15–40 °C (optimum 25–30 °C) and pH 5.0–9.5 (optimum pH 6.0–7.5).
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite, but nitrogen gas is not produced.

With API 20 NE, positive for glucose acidification, assimilation of d-glucose, d-mannitol, gluconate and adipic acid and hydrolysis of aesculin and tyrosine, weakly positive for assimilation of N-acetylglucosamine, maltose and malic acid, but negative for indole production, arginine dihydrolase, assimilation of l-arabinose, d-mannose, capric acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid and hydrolysis of urea, gelatin, Tweens 20 and 80, casein and starch.

With API ZYM, positive for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase activities, weakly positive for α-chymotrypsin and α-galactosidase, but negative for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α- and β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-fucosidase and α-mannose.
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-10.
The major cellular fatty acids (>10 % of total) are C18 : 1ω7c, C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c, summed feature 3 (comprising C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH) and C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.5 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain is AD8T ( = KACC 13699T = DSM 22011T), which was isolated from a tidal flat of the Taean coast in South Korea.
